description: A traditional method of cooling drinking water using a clay pot, known as matka, which utilizes evaporation to provide naturally cool water.
steps: Store drinking water in a clay pot (matka).
Place the matka in a shaded and airy location.
Position the matka on a stand for better airflow.
Cover the mouth of the matka with a clean cloth to prevent dust and insects.
Wash the pot weekly and change the water daily to avoid algae and odor.
risks: Potential for contamination if not cleaned regularly.
Water may become warm if not placed in a shaded area.
